bioghist.p: John W. Jordan was an avid theater, ballet, and classical music patron in Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains programs and playbills for hundreds of theater and concert performances in Philadelphia over more than three decades. Some other regional companies are represented and there are a handful of New York shows as well. Many of the programs have ticket stubs stapled to the covers and some have reviews laid in them. The Philadelphia Orchestra is well represented, as are the Pennsylvania Ballet, Walnut St. Theatre, Temple Symphony Orchestra, and Temple Opera Theater. The Arden, Forrest, and Wilma Theaters, Opera Company of Philadelphia, Mask & Wig Club, and Plays & Players are also well represented, and a handful of programs for a number of other groups are also included.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
